title: Detecting Biological Agent Attacks
brief: How to recognize the signs of biological warfare agent deployment and contamination.
steps: Step 1: Watch for unusual munitions with minimal blast damage but small liquid/powder clouds.
Step 2: Look for aircraft or vehicle spray tanks creating aerosol clouds.
Step 3: Check for large infestations of insects (mosquitoes, fleas, lice, ticks) that may be vectors.
Step 4: Observe for unusual substances on ground or vegetation, or sick-looking plants/animals.
Step 5: Monitor for symptoms in people: dizziness, confusion, blurred vision, numbness, paralysis.
Step 6: Note that aerosol sprays concentrate in low terrain areas like morning mist.
warnings: Biological agents cannot be detected by the five senses
Symptoms may not appear for hours to months due to incubation period
Buildings and bunkers can trap agents at higher concentrations
